events.event_description: U.S. natural gas consumption reached a new annual high of 89.4 billion cubic feet per day in 2023, driven by a 6.7% increase in electric power sector consumption.
events.citation: U.S. natural gas consumption grew by 1% to reach a new annual high of 89.4 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) in 2023, according to our Natural Gas Annual, and continued growing in the first nine months of 2024. The 1% increase in natural gas consumption in 2023 was driven by a 6.7% (2.2 Bcf/d) increase in consumption in the electric power sector

events.event_description: Residential natural gas consumption hit a five-year low, averaging 12.4 Bcf/d in 2023, showing the largest year-over-year decline in five years.
events.citation: natural gas consumption in the residential sector reached a five-year low at an average 12.4 Bcf/d in 2023, down by 8.9% (1.2 Bcf/d) from 2022, the largest year-over-year decline in the past five years

events.event_description: The Northern Hemisphere experienced its hottest summer on record in 2023, leading to increased natural gas consumption for air conditioning.
events.citation: The summer of 2023 was the hottest recorded in the Northern Hemisphere, increasing consumption of natural gas in the electric power sector to meet demand for air conditioning

events.event_description: U.S. natural gas consumption through September 2024 averaged 89.8 Bcf/d, up 1% from the same period in 2023, with electric power sector consumption increasing by 4%.
events.citation: U.S. natural gas consumption through September 2024 averaged 89.8 Bcf/d according to our monthly data, up 1% from the same period in 2023. The increase was driven by a 4% (1.6 Bcf/d) increase in consumption in the electric power sector
